SRP.A: The peak of  Soft Drinks is to the {left} of the peak of Energy Drinks.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Juices} has the highest peak.

EVJ.A: At X =16350.7,the label with the highest density is {Juices}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 69032? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Energy Drinks}'s peak at {85085},{Alcoholic Beverages}'s peak at {71548},{Soft Drinks}'s peak at {79379}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Alcoholic Beverages or Soft Drinks?
NC.A: {Soft Drinks} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Juices or Soft Drinks?
NC.A: {Soft Drinks} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Energy Drinks or Juices?
NC.A: {Energy Drinks} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Juices or Alcoholic Beverages?
NC.A: {Alcoholic Beverages} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Juices}
